meteringrange: 0 to 20 EV: 3D Color Matrix, Center-Weighted Metering or highlight weighted metering / Spot Metering
interfacelanguages: Arabic, Bengali, Brazilian Portuguese, Bulgarian, Chinese (Simplified and Traditional), Czech, Danish, Dutch, English, Finnish, French, German, Greek, Hindi, Hungarian, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Marathi, Norwegian, Persian, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Russian, Serbian, Spanish, Swedish, Tamil, Telugu, Thai, Turkish, Ukrainian, Vietnamese
flashsyncspeed: Up to 1/200 sec. Synchronizes with shutter at 1/250s or slower (flash range drops at speeds between 1/200 and 1/250s)
whitebalancebracketing: 2 to 9 exposures in increments of 1, 2 or 3 EV
activedlighting: Auto Extra High High Normal Low Off
picturecontrol: Flat Landscape Monochrome Neutral Portrait Standard User-customizable Settings Vivid
incameraimageediting: Color Balance, Color Outline, Color Sketch, D-Lighting, Distortion Control, Edit Movie, Filter Effects, Fisheye, Image Overlay, Miniature Effect, Monochrome, NEF (RAW) Processing, Perspective Control, Quick Retouch, Red-Eye Correction, Resize, Selective Color, Side-by-Side Comparison, Straighten, Trim
dustreduction: Image Sensor Cleaning Image Dust Off reference data (optional Capture NX-D software required)
continuousshooting: FX-format CH: Up to 6.5 frames per second CL: Up to 1-6 frames per second DX-format CH: Up to 6.5 frames per second CL: Up to 1-6 frames per second
playbackfunctions: Auto Image Rotation, Full-Frame and Thumbnail (4, 9, or 72 images or calendar), Highlights, Histogram Display, Image Comment, Movie Playback, Movie Slideshow, Playback with Zoom, Slideshow
stillimageformat: JPEG: JPEG-Baseline compliant with fine (approx 1:4), normal (approx 1:8), or basic (approx 1:16) compression (Size priority); Optimal quality compression available NEF (RAW) + JPEG: Single photograph recorded in both NEF (RAW) and JPEG formats NEF (RAW): Lossless compressed, compressed 12 or 14 bit
selftimer: 2, 5, 10, 20 sec.; 1 to 9 exposures at intervals of 0.5, 1, 2, or 3 sec. (Timer duration electronically controlled)
meteringmodes: Centre-weighted: Weight of 75% given to 12mm circle in centre of frame. Diameter of circle can be changed to 8, 15, or 20mm, or weighting can be based on average of entire frame (non-CPU lenses use 12mm circle) Matrix: 3D Colour Matrix Metering II (type G, E, and D lenses); Colour Matrix Metering II (other CPU lenses); Colour Matrix Metering available with non-CPU lenses if user provides lens data Spot: Meters 4mm circle (about 1.5% of frame) centered on selected focus point (on centre focus point when non-CPU lens is used) Highlight-weighted: Available with type G, E, and D lenses; equivalent to center-weighted when non-CPU lens is used
type: Wide Viewing Angle TFT-LCD w/ 170° viewing angle
lensservo: Autofocus (AF): Single-servo AF (AF-S); continuous-servo AF (AF-C); auto AF-S/AF-C selection (AF-A); predictive focus tracking activated automatically according to subject status Manual focus (MF): Electronic rangefinder can be used
gps: Supports optional Nikon GP-1 & GP-1A GPU units
flashexposurecompensation: -3 to +1 EV in increments of 1/3, 1/2 or 1 EV
autofocussystem: 51 focus points (including 15 cross-type sensors; f/8 supported by 11 sensors) AF-assist illuminator: ~0.5-3m range Finetuning Nikon Advanced Multi-CAM 3500FX II autofocus sensor module with TTL phase detection
focuslock: Focus can be locked by pressing AE-L/AF-L button Focus can be locked by pressing shutter-release button halfway (single-servo AF)
flashsync: Auto Auto FP High-Speed Sync supported Auto with red-eye reduction Auto slow sync Auto slow sync with red-eye reduction Fill-flash Rear-curtain sync Rear-curtain with slow sync Red-Eye reduction Red-Eye reduction with slow sync Slow sync Off
exposuremetering: TTL exposure metering using 91,000-pixel RGB sensor
focusingscreen: Type B BriteView Clear Matte Mark III screen with AF area brackets (framing grid can be displayed)
fileformat: H.264 / MPEG-4 Advanced Video Coding Audio: Linear PCM (Stereo)
shutterrelease: Continuous low-speed [CL] mode Continuous high-speed [CH] mode Mirror-up [Mup] mode Quiet Shutter Release mode Quiet Continuous Release mode Self-timer mode Single-frame [S] mode
recordingformats: Compliant with DCF 2.0 DPOF PictBridge EXIF 2.3
afareamode: 9, 21 or 51 point Dynamic-area AF Auto-area AF Single-point AF 3D-tracking (51 points) Group-area AF
moviemetering: TTL exposure metering using main image sensor
movieaudio: Built-in Stereo Microphone Optional: External Stereo Microphone
flashbracketing: 2 to 5 frames in steps of 2 or 3 EV 2 to 9 frames in steps of 1/3, 1/2, 2/3 or 1 EV
exposurecompensation: ±5 EV in increments of 1/3, 1/2 in P, S, A and M modes
exposuremodes: Aperture-Priority (A) Manual (M) Programmed auto with flexible program (P) Shutter-Priority (S)
dlightingbracketing: 2 frames using selected value for one frame 3–5 frames using preset values for all frames
settings: Auto (2 types) Choose color temperature (2,500K–10,000K) Cloudy Direct Sunlight Flash Fluorescent (7 types) Incandescent Preset manual (Stores up to 6 values, spot white balance measurement available during live view) Shade
focusingmodes: Autofocus (AF): Single-servo AF (AF-S); Continuous-servo AF (AF-C); predictive focus tracking activated automatically according to subject status Manual focus (MF): Electronic rangefinder can be used
flashcontrol: TTL: i-TTL flash control using 91,000-pixel RGB sensor are available with built-in flash and SB-910, SB-900, SB-800, SB-700, SB-600, SB-400, or SB-300; i-TTL balanced fill-flash for digital SLR is used with matrix and center-weighting metering, standard i-TTL flash for digital SLR with spot metering
